titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Woolfolk Family Papers 1775-1893
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in the
Manuscripts and Rare Books Department Mss. 39.1 W88

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary
did.unittitle:
Woolfolk Family Papers,
1775-1893
did.abstract: Correspondence and business records of members of the Woolfolk family of Caroline County, Virginia, dating 1775-1893. The Woollfolk family was engaged in two firms and a stage line.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts and Rare Books, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift: 3,980 items, 5 November 1937. Gift: 6,000 items, 27 June 1939.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Woolfolk family originally emigrated from Wales. John George Woolfolk (1750-1819) ran a stage line and had a contract to carry the mail. His sons Pichegru Woolfolk and Jourdan Woolfolk continued the stage line. Jourdan had a son, John William Woolfolk, among other children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers of the Woolfolk family of Caroline County, Virginia including correspondence and accounts of John George Woolfolk, Jourdan Woolfolk, Pichegru Woolfolk and John William Woolfolk. The collection includes correspondence, accounts and vouchers for the stage line run by the Woolfolk family (Allen & Woolfolk; Jourdan Woolfolk & Company; and Woolfolk & Hoomes). Includes records of routes, rates, supplies, arrangements for layover of passengers and mail contracts of the Potomac Steamboat and Stage Company as well as papers concerning stock purchases in the Richmond, Fredericksburg, and Potomac Railroad. Also includes bound account books for the stage lines. Note: Includes letters written by James Lyons, Timothy Pickering, Robert Ryland and Benjamin Waller; letters of and accounts concerning members of the Maury family; and lists, 1829 and 1837, of vaccinated slaves. Lot 2 consists of about 6000 pieces of papers of the Woolfolk Family of Caroline County, Virgini, dated 1793-1876. There are financial records relating to the stage line and mailservice, records relating to agricultural business, correspondence, insurance records, military records, records relating to the erection of Antioch Baptist Church, and copies of newspapers.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into 14 series. Lot 1 comprises series 1-7. Lot 2 comprises series 8-14. There is a certain overlap between some of the series of lot 1 and 2. Lot 2 is has not been processed beyond the Series arrangement. Series 1: Correspondence relating to the stage line; Series 2: Accounts and vouchers of the stage line; Series 3: Other papers relating to the stage line and the Richmond, Fredericksburg, and Potomac Railroad; Series 4: Correspondence of the Woolfolk family; Series 5: Papers of various persons, A-Z; Series 6: Other Papers; Series 7: Bound volumes; Series 8: Papers relating to the stage and mail service operated by members of the Woolfolk Family; Series 9: Papers relating to members of the Woolfolk Family, A-Z; Series 10: Papers relating to the estate of John Hoomes; Series 11: Subscription lists, invoices and receipts relative to the erection of Antioch Christian Church, Bowling Green, Virginia; Series 12: Records of the Caroline troop of cavalry, 1816-1820; Series 13: Newspapers; Series 14: Miscellaneous.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Lot 1: The series are arranged chronologically, with the exception of series 5, which is arranged alphabetically by last name and chronologically within. Lot 2: Series 9 is arranged alphabetically by last name; the other series of Lot 2 have not been further arranged at this point.

controlaccess.head: Corporate name:
controlaccess.corpname: Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railraod Compnay..

c01.head: Series 1: Correspondence relating to the stage line

did.unittitle: Correspondence relating to the stage line, 1795-1844, 1938.
Old Mulberry Place, 2 January 1938.

scopecontent.p: An article by Vera Palmer in the Richmond Times Dispatch, January 2, 1938, concerning the Woolfolk family, the stage line, and Mulberry Place, the Woolfolk plantation in Caroline County, Virginia.

did.unittitle: Correspondence relating to the stage line operated by members of the Woolfolk family, 1795-1844.

scopecontent.p: This file contains also letters relating to the carrying mails and to connections with the Fredericksburg and Potomac Steamship Company, and the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad.

c01.head: Series 2: Accounts and vouchers of the stage line

did.unittitle:
Accounts and vouchers of the stage line,
1788-1845.

Accounts of the stage line operated by members of the Woolfolk family,
1788-1845.

scopecontent.p: This file contains also accounts of the Potomac Steamboat and Stage Company and accounts for the carrying of mail. All the accounts after 1840 pertain to the carrying of mail. See also Bound Volumes.

c01.head: Series 3: Papers relating to the stage line and the Richmond, Fredericksburg, and Potomac Railroad

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to the stage line and the Richmond, Fredericksburg, and Potomac Railroad,
1796-1851.

arrangement.p: Arranged into two groups: papers realting to the stage line are followed by papers relating to the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad, within each group chronological.

did.unittitle: Robert Armistead to William Townes and Alexander McRae, 1796.

scopecontent.p: Trust deed to secure payment to John G. Woolfolk for the purchase of his interest in the stage line from Richmond to Norfolk and in the carrying of mail by that line, and from Osborns to Bermuda hundred.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to the purchase of horses probably used for the stage line,
1811-1831.
Schedule of fares from Richmond to Fredericksburg, ca. 1820.
Agreement of Edwin Porter & Co., and Jourdan Woolfolk with N. C. Lipscomb concerning the boarding of stage drivers and passengers, 1823.
Contract of Jourdan Woolfolk with the United States for carrying mail from Bowling Green, Virginia, by Turner's Store, to White Chimneys, and back, twice a week, 1838.
Contract of Jourdan Woolfolk with the United States for carrying the mail from Bowling Green, Virginia, by Turner's Store and White Chimneys, to Mahgohic, and back, twice a week, 1843.

List of subscribers to the Richmond and Potomac railroad survey whose subscriptions were returned by Jourdan Woolfolk,
1834.
Papers relating to cash transactions of Jourdan Woolfolk with the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad, 1835-1837.

scopecontent.p: Includes several receipts for cash paid in purchase of stock.

did.unittitle: Vouchers relating to payments for and dividends on stock in the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad purchased by Pichegru and John Woolfolk, 1835-1876.

c01.head: Series 8: Papers relating to the stage and mail service operated by members of the Woolfolk family

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to the stage and mail service operated by members of the Woolfolk family,
1789-1845.

arrangement.p: Papers in this series have not been arranged yet.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous financial records, 1789, 1802-1836.

scopecontent.p: Contains tax records, receipts, correspondence, and accounts.

did.unittitle:
Contracts and miscellaneous financial records,
1815-1845.

scopecontent.p: Contains a contract with the U.S. Government and several Post Office contracts, a share in the Potomac Steamboat Company, correspondence and miscellaneous financial records.

did.unittitle:
Miscellaneous financial and legal records,
1798-1844.

scopecontent.p: Contains receipts, accounts, records and correspondence pertaining to legal questions regarding the Woolfolk family business.

did.unittitle:
Miscellaneous financial records,
1817-1824.

scopecontent.p: Contains receipts and accounts.

did.unittitle:
Accounts,
1809-1836.

Correspondence,
1836-1838.
Government publications, ca. 1833-1834, 1841, 1849

scopecontent.p: Includes two issues of the National Intelligenzer, 1841 and 1849, as well as two incomplete volumes of government publications on legislation regarding mail service (ca. 1833-1834).

did.unittitle:
Miscellaneous business records,
1796-1821.

scopecontent.p: Includes accounts, business correspondence and tax receipts for John G. Woolflok, John Hoomes, and Woolfolk & Holmes with various clients.

did.unittitle: Business correspondence received by Jourdan Woolfolk, 1813, 1828, 1836-1838.

scopecontent.p: Includes letters received by Jourdan Woolfolk, Bowling Green, Caroline County, Virginia. The bulk of the letters were written by B.[?] Bradley, Washington D.C. Also includes letters from Conway Robinson, President of the Richmond, Fredericksburg, and Potomac Railroad Company, and letters (copied) by Bradley to Robinson and others.

c01.head: Series 9: Papers relating to members of the Woolfolk Family, A-Z

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to members of the Woolfolk Family, A-Z,
1794-1890.

arrangement.p: Papers in this series have not been arranged yet.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating Elizabeth P. Woolfolk,
1815-1839.

scopecontent.p: Includes accounts and receipts for household items and relating to agricultural operations, including a medical bill for slaves, tuition bills, and receipts for wages paid to James Cox.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to John Woolfolk,
1834-1854.

scopecontent.p: Includes accounts and receipts of John Woolfolk, including a subscription list for a church building (n.d.), as well as a list of bonds on his estate (1854).

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to Frances Woolfolk and his estate,
1794-1801.

scopecontent.p: Includes will of Frances Woolfolk (1794), estate inventory and papers relating to his estate and his two orphaned children, Sallie and Anna (John G. Woolfolk, guardian). Also includes medical bills with medical fees for visits to slaves, as well as tuition bills.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to John Woolfolk,
1839-1857.
did.physdesc: Several bonds are mutilated: signature has been torn out.

scopecontent.p: Includes bonds, bills, accounts, and receipts.

did.unittitle: Papers relating to John Woolfolk, 1786, 1810-1845.

scopecontent.p: Includes accounts, receipts, legal records, a workmen's book, and a surveyer's report.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to John G. Woolfolk's estate,
1805-1852.

scopecontent.p: Includes accounts, bonds, an indemnification bond, insurance policies, receipts, memoranda, banknotes, deeds and indentures, as well as a deed of trust documenting the sale of a slave and her two children. Also included are accounts of Sophia Hoomes with John G. Woolfolk, who was her guardian. Also includes a letter from Richard Woolfolk, Jefferson County, 1810, explaining his financial problems and the sale of slaves. He also mentions the sale of a horse to St. George Tucker.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to the Estate of John W. Woolfolk,
1843-1890.

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, report cards from Bethany College (West Virginia), accounts, receipts, and bills.

did.unittitle:
Jourdan Woolfolk correspondence,
1821-1866.

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence dating 1821-1866. Of special interest is the Civil War correspondence. A letter to Jourdan Woolfolk, written by Roy Huly [?], Edge Mont. [?], dated 26 July 1864, describes an encouter with Sheridan's forces: according to Huly's account, horses and four slave boys were led away and but there was little damage property. Also includes a group of letters from Confederate soldiers, a group of letters relating to the culture of silkworms, and bancruptcy notices.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to Jourdan Woofolk,
1833-1867.

scopecontent.p: Included are indentures, agreements, court summons, membership certificates, insurance policies, and estate accounts for John M. Burke.

did.unittitle:
Jourdan Woolfolk account book,
1854-1868.

scopecontent.p: Accounts with various individuals. Includes name index.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to Jourdan Woolfolk,
1815-1823.

scopecontent.p: Vouchers.

did.unittitle:
Papers relating to Sarah Woolfolk,
1807-1813.

scopecontent.p: Bond.

1816-1820.

scopecontent.p: Includes lists of delinquents at muster 1816-1817, amount of money collected at a muster, n.d., reports of troop meetings, and a financial record.

did.unittitle: Newspapers, 1842.

arrangement.p: Papers in this series have not been arranged yet.

did.unittitle: Newspaper, 1842.

scopecontent.p: Issue of the Richmond Enquirer, September 6, 1842. The following issues of the Richmond Whig and Public Advertiser that were originally part of this collection, were moved to the Newspaper Collection: February 15, 1839, October 7, 1840, and February 12, 1842.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous, 1796- ca.193-.

arrangement.p: Papers in this series have not been arranged yet.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous, 1796- ca.193-.

scopecontent.p: Includes memoranda, receipts, instructions, accountbooks, bonds. A plat showing property lines and listing the names of owners, n.d. A 1795 copy of Constitutions, Rules and Regulations of the Mutual Assurance Society of Virginia was transferred to the Rare Books Collection.
